snippet: A falling stock market and currency, and an explosion aboard a submarine, have contributed to doubts about India’s status as a dominant powerhouse of Asia.
abstract: Falling stock market and currency, as well as explosion aboard  submarine, contribute to doubts about India’s status as dominant powerhouse of Asia; country had previously been viewed as poised to take its place alongside China as economic and strategic force as its economy was surging, its military was strengthening, and its leaders were striding across world stage.

byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and BETTINA WASSENER
byline.contributor: Gardiner Harris reported from New Delhi, and Bettina Wassener from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: A falling stock market and currency, and an explosion aboard a submarine, have contributed to doubts about India’s status as a dominant powerhouse of Asia.

headline.main: A Summer of Troubles Saps India’s Sense of Confidence
headline.print_headline: A Summer of Troubles Saps India’s Sense of Confidence
